column8:
Mensagem do Primeiro-Ministro para a XIX Cimeira Ibero Americana, publicada no sítio internet www.cimeiraiberoamericana.gov.pt

Nos finais deste mês de Novembro iremos acolher no Estoril a XIX Cimeira de Chefes de Estado e Governo Ibero-americanos. É com enorme satisfação e honra que Portugal, enquanto Presidência

pro tempore

da Conferencia Ibero-Americana, organiza mais uma vez uma Cimeira desta envergadura.

O tema da Cimeira será, este ano, dedicado à «Inovação e Conhecimento», sendo certo que o mesmo, no actual contexto da crise económica e financeira mundial, assume hoje uma importância estratégica, razão pela qual esperamos enviar uma mensagem forte e com impacto, quer na comunidade internacional, quer junto das nossas opiniões públicas, no sentido de apostar na inovação e conhecimento.

Os diversos encontros paralelos de representantes da sociedade civil dos países ibero-americanos permitirão, estou em crer, realçar a relevância dos nossos trabalhos e darão expressão adicional ao espírito de diálogo, de solidariedade e de concertação que hoje caracteriza a realidade da Conferência Ibero-Americana.

Estamos confiantes em que a actualidade e a relevância do tema desta XIX Cimeira permitirão igualmente uma participação e um intercâmbio de experiencias de grande significado e importância para o continuado fortalecimento e a projecção internacional da nossa Comunidade Ibero-Americana.

Teremos, pois, muito gosto em acolher a XIX Cimeira de Chefes de Estado e Governo Ibero-americanos e todas as delegações e órgãos de comunicação social que nela participarem.

José Sócrates

Primeiro-Ministro de Portugal

column1: Apresentação do Programa do Governo à Assembleia da República
column6: Speech of the Prime Minister at the presentation of the XVIII Constitutional Government Programme to Parliament Mr. President Ladies and gentlemen1. greetingsI appeal to Parliament, at the beginning of term, with satisfaction and sense of responsibility. Satisfaction because I stand before you as the Prime Minister of the XVIII Constitutional Government, as a result of the will of the people expressed in elections. Sense of responsibility because I am well aware of the difficulties, the requirements and challenges of the present moment.I want first of all, welcome, friendship and admiration with the President of the Parliament. His recent re-election, Mr President, a majority so expressive in this Parliament, was able to overcome the party lines and was a political fact of the greatest importance, worthy of due attention.For my part, I realize well that the Parliament does not want to miss the great President that has had. By voting as voted, the House has made a very just tribute to his person, his political life and, above all, the top shape as you have. It has been able to carry out their duties in Parliament. The truth is that the Portuguese democracy owes much and still have to expect from you.I also welcome heartily, all MPs ladies and gentlemen all Members of the various stands. Among all, allow me to health, especially the more than 100 Members of Parliament that this legislature première in Parliament. The renewal that your presence means, goes hand in hand with the renewal that has begun in the local authorities and that will intensify in the forthcoming local elections, as a result of the courageous law limitation of executive mandates, here we adopted in the last legislature. This renewal movement is, in itself, a sign of hope, and I have no doubt, is another service we provide to the qualification of Portuguese democracy.A word also to greet the whole Parliament. Why all the Parliament appreciates the fact that, for the first time, be set up under the new Parity Law, which promotes and ensures the indispensable participation of women in the Portuguese political life!I am sure that even those benches that needed the law of momentum to finally open the meaningful participation of women now understand that this was a necessary step and no longer want to go backwards. Henceforth, what is worth discussing this matter is how it was possible that the Portuguese democracy delayed so long to ensure meaningful participation of women in its parliament, the house where one must realize the representation of the entire national community!2. The relationship of the government with Parliament I wish also at this early moment, to realize the full availability of the Government to cooperate with the Parliament. I know well what are the legislative powers of government and the competences of the executive branch. ANDI remember that the Constitution protects the proper sphere of the Executive Branch, through the principle of separation of powers and its corollary which is the "management reserve 'that fits all respect. In a word, resulting of the Constitution is that the ruler is the Government.I am less aware of the legislative powers of Parliament and in particular its important political oversight function - important, moreover, to the proper functioning of democracy in the framework of our system of government.It was precisely by being fully aware of the importance of democratic oversight role of the Assembly did not hesitate to contribute to the reform of Parliament held in the last legislature. A reform that extended the duties of government and strengthened the rights and prerogatives of the opposition. There is no memory of ever this happened with such depth. I honor myself, so to be the Prime Minister that, on its own initiative, more times came accountable to Parliament - and will not let you do this, once more, over the next four years.It can therefore, this House rely on the best spirit of cooperation on the part of any government. Of all his ministers. And of all his ministers.3. The democratic legitimacy of the government that the Portuguese choseMr. President Ladies and gentlemenI believe this is one of those political moments where it is appropriate to begin by emphasizing the obvious. And the obvious is that this government was sworn in, as mandated by the Constitution, 'in view of the election results. " It could not be otherwise. But it is very important to remind you: the President of the Republic invited me to form government in the leadership position of the party on September 27 won the elections.We all know that the new parliamentary framework does not give any party an absolute majority. It is true. But that does not mean that the elections have not had a winning party. Why they had. And the Portuguese gave to the winning party what can be considered a clear victory.That's why the Government presented here, to Parliament, it is the Government which is the will of the Portuguese people, freely and democratically expressed in the ballot box. This is therefore a government with full democratic legitimacy to govern in the four years of this term!4. The Government program that the Portuguese votedWell: the Government that the Portuguese chose, is here to present exactly the same program that the Portuguese voted!The program that the government submit to this Assembly is the one that was presented as an election program and Government by the party that won the elections - Only expurgated, of course, the party references or mere balance of the last legislature.This is undoubtedly the best way to ensure full respect for the expressed will of the voters!Of course, the situation would be totally different if it had been possible to reach an agreement with any of the parties in Parliament for a political solution that would contribute to the strengthening of the political stability that the country so badly needs. If such convergence was possible, then yes, it would give rise to a new programmatic platform, the result of a compromise between different programs. But this is not the case.As the Portuguese know - and certainly take note for future memory - invited all parties with parliamentary representation more relevant for a political dialogue, without preconditions, aimed at determining the feasibility of a lasting understanding in favor of stability. The refusal of all is known. No party wanted to take responsibility or commitment to governance. None of the parties agreed to even talk about it, including those who in recent years have called for dialogue and convergence.And therefore, I confess I do not understand - and I think there is in the country who understands - those parties of the Opposition who rushed to criticize the government for presenting its program as the program that the Socialist Party took the elections. It is that, however badly ask, gentlemen gentlemen, then the government, not presenting the PS program, should after all present the program who ?!The truth is that the parties of the Opposition at the time they chose to refuse any dialogue that would be to identify the feasibility and the terms of a commitment to governmental stability, self-excluded themselves deliberately from any input on the Government Program content. And can not therefore surprising that the Government here present the program that is your own!The Executive's attitude could only be this: to present to Parliament, as its program, the political program presented to the elections. It is this program that the government has. It is this program that the Government will endeavor to fulfill, thus fulfilling also the will of the Portuguese!5. The nature of parliamentary investitureBut, ladies and gentlemen, let us be clear: for the purposes of parliamentary investiture, which asks the political parties represented here is not necessarily agree with all the government program - because, as we well know, everyone here were elected due own programs which are different from each other.The question is another: the timing of parliamentary investiture is the time when the Parliament takes part in the institutionalization of governance solution that follows the democratic expression of the will of the people. Put more simply: this is the time that the Assembly recognizes or not the legitimacy of the government to govern.What it is, it is the Parliament - which represents the nation as a result of the legislative elections - recognizing that this XVIII Constitutional Government, sworn in by the President of the Republic, corresponds in fact to the result of the elections. And it is above all, the lack of availability of other parties for any lasting political commitment, Parliament allow the Government to enter into the fullness of functions to fulfill the program that is yours - as the Portuguese the sufragaram, when asked to choose the best for the country.In short, in order to fulfill this parliamentary investiture, which asks the opposition parties represented in Parliament is a responsible attitude to the service of the good functioning of democratic institutions and the country's interest. I'm sure it will not be too much to ask!6. The three main priorities of the Government ProgrammeMr. President Ladies and gentlemenThe Government Programme for the legislature that now begins is clear on its priorities and of course in their choices.The first priority is to combat the crisis, revive the economy and promote employment.The second priority is to modernize the country. Modernize the economy, modernizing the society, modernize the state.The third priority is to develop social policies, qualify public services and reduce inequalities.And it is these key priorities of the Government here want to talk.7. To combat the crisis, revive the economy and promote employmentWe take responsibility to govern well aware of the enormous difficulties of the moment. In fact, there are still clearly visible, the serious effects of increased international economic crisis of the last eighty years.Admittedly, thanks to the prompt response and determined that we gave to this situation, the Portuguese economy was the first to come out of technical recession. It is also true that in recent months have begun to emerge, with increasing consistency, the first signs of economic recovery. The latest forecast of the European Commission, reviewing for high economic growth, confirms these signs. But have no illusions: the crisis is not over yet. Far from it.That is why, I want to take here, quite clearly, that it is the first task of government: to work with all sectors of Portuguese society to overcome the economic crisis and to consolidate a path of sustained growth of our economy.I know some, the first positive signs already precipitate in the usual litany, asking the State to take a step back and suggesting up, more or less explicitly, the abandonment of the stimulus to the economy. We know them well. In general, are the same as for pure ideological prejudice, they never liked to see the state to intervene to prevent the worst in the economy, to stabilize the financial system and ensure credit to support businesses and protect jobs, to help families and the most affected by the crisis. The truth is that if we had followed their advice, the situation would be far worse. It was determined and coordinated intervention of States to prevent the collapse of the financial sector has lowered interest rates, avoided many bankruptcies, managed to save many jobs and helped many families. It was the intervention of states that made the difference between what the world lived with the Depression of 1929 and the current situation, in which already are the first upward revision of growth prospects.I believe my duty is to be absolutely clear on this matter, when I present the Government Programme. And I sayIt would be a mistake - and a very serious mistake - withdraw before long, even in crisis, the stimulus and special state support to the economy, industry and employment. We are not in that time! And we do not commit this error!On the contrary. The duty of the state remains today as before, help companies overcome this difficult situation. As it remains the duty of the State to promote the initiatives necessary to reduce as far as possible, the impact of the crisis on unemployment and household living conditions.I say more: there will be no economic recovery without the decisive contribution of the State and public investment!That is why, the first topic of our economic policy agenda is this: move forward with modernizing public investment. That's what we proposed to the country, with all the letters in the electoral program; that's what we discussed during the campaign; and that is, consistently, is written in our Government Program.We will continue, therefore, with the upgrading and modernization of schools programs; building social and health equipment; investment in renewable energy, the sanitation system and water supply and in next generation networks.But it will also modernizing the investment in our transport infrastructure that the country's future requires. And that means, above all, moving with high speed priority lines (Lisbon-Madrid and Lisbon-Porto-Vigo); requalify conventional rail transport; launch the construction of the new Lisbon airport in Alcochete; and continue the implementation of the National Road Plan.Our program to boost the economy and employment bet also on two key strategic tools: one Pact for Internationalization it is a Employment Pact. Our goal is to summon all economic agents and all the social partners in a structured and consistent social dialogue. A dialogue which support effective solutions to the internationalization of the economy and the value of our exports to job creation, adaptation of labor market policies, safeguarding the interests of workers and the definition of medium-term trend lines in the minimum wage .Alongside this, our agenda to revive the economy also includes a special attention to small and medium-sized enterprises. We will create a new fund of 250 million euros to support development capital operations of SMEs from international markets. We support about 30 000 SMEs per year using the mechanisms to support the credit and equity reinforcement mechanisms, in addition to other instruments to support the modernization and competitiveness. We will continue also to fight the bureaucracy and reducing the pay of public entities deadlines programs.Reinforce, likewise, the partnership with the institutions of the so-called social economy or the social sector. And I want to highlight three measures: We will create a specific line of subsidized credit to the social sector; We will launch the new Program to Support the Development of Social Economy (PAdES), with a minimum allocation of 50 million euros; andwe will adopt, since the Council of Ministers next week, what will be the first measure of the government: the Inov-Social Program, which will support the placement in social institutions 1,000 young professionals a year in order to support their modernization and promote youth employment.public investment; Pact for the Internationalization and Employment Pact; support for small and medium-sized enterprises; strengthening the partnership with the social sector - these are the priority lines of our strategy to address the crisis, revive the economy and promote employment.I want to point out, however, that we maintain the perfect awareness of the importance of consolidation of public finances, to the sustainability of social policies and the sustained growth objectives of the Portuguese economy. But let us be absolutely clear: the priority of economic and fiscal policy will be, as it has to be at the present time, the recovery of the Portuguese economy. ANDonly once overcome the current difficulties arising from the global crisis will resume booster path of long-term sustainability of public finances, following the strategy that will be defined at European level.Stay clear, however, that even in this situation of crisis, we will not fail to act with the necessary sense of responsibility, using rigor in expenditure control and selectivity in investment. As always we did. What gives credibility to this government with respect to public accounts is the work done by the beginning of the crisis in reducing the deficit in the balance of public finances, structural reforms in the service of fiscal sustainability, which is essential in the modern state .We will use as the fiscal stimulus responsibly, driving them selectively for specific policy objectives, such as the defense of employment and export promotion. And we refuse to define the role in governance agenda of what simply may seem nicer and more popular. Our way is another. Our path is the path of responsibility.8. Modernising PortugalMr. President Ladies and gentlemenThe mandate of the Government is also to modernize Portugal and advance the country. Therefore, the horizon of our program is beyond the situation and has his sights set on the future. The challenge is very demanding: it is to continue the path of reform so as to overcome structural blockages to our development and competitiveness of our economy. And this is done moving forward. With initiative with courage, with persistence - and ambition.Our choices are also here, very clear.First of all, We want to lead the energy revolution. This means we will continue investing in energy efficiency and renewable energy - but also means consolidating the position of Portugal in the technological frontier of energy. This is the sure way. To combat global warming, to reduce our dependence on oil, to reduce the external deficit and reduce the debt of the country.Our goal is to double by 2020 our electricity generation capacity from renewable sources; is increased to 8500 MW, also by 2020, the installed wind power; It is to realize the National Dam Plan; is multiplied by 10 in 10 years, the current goal of solar energy. But it is also, and very importantly, take the lead in new technological and industrial sector of electric transport vehicles. The electric car is now the forefront of research in the automotive industry. Portugal wants to be at the forefront of this race, as we are at the forefront of renewable. And it is on the front line that we want to continue to be.In second place, we approach Portugal's economic center of Europe, European markets. This means countering the peripheral condition of the country, which severely penalizes our competitiveness. If there is a right strategic vision for a country like Portugal it passes undoubtedly the modernization of connecting infrastructure of our economy and our society to Central Europe and the rest of the world. The answer lies in strategic investments in logistics infrastructure, mobility and communications. Reflecting the high-speed network; build the Third Crossing of the Tagus; build the new Lisbon airport; start exploring the Beja airport; continue the implementation of the National Road Plan and the motorway network; affirming the competitiveness of our ports; implement an efficient logistics system - these are the main focus of public investment to bring Portugal's center and make Portugal a country that does not give up your future and the ambition to become more modern and competitive.In third place, we continue efforts to value the qualifications of the Portuguese. The very way been in recent years does not mean that there is still a long way to walk. We will therefore insist on the fight against abandonment and school failure andwe will ensure, finally, the universalization of secondary education. But let's do it with the new scholarship, aimed at high school students who are beneficiaries of the first two levels of the family allowance. At the same time, we consolidate the commitment to vocational education;We will launch a new program New Opportunities cycle; We pursue the modernization of school facilities; We continue to strengthen education social action and propose a true Trust Agreement to institutions of higher education, including the issue of financing.But since I refer our priorities in the education sector, I must say a word here about the issue of teacher assessment. I want everyone to know that the objective of the Government is this: to promote the good performance of public school. Because it is very important for the future of the country, for families and for students that public school is, in fact, up to their enormous responsibilities. And it is for this reason thatpublic school can not do without a serious and fair teacher evaluation, to distinguish and appreciate the merit. The government wants a dialogue and dialogue with results. A dialogue that gathers the teachings of the experience of teachers and schools that take on the work that has been done and is ongoing, that meets the technical opinions that approach positions and to identify with accuracy, improvements needed to be made to the future.One thing I think nobody wants to: return to the past, where the good performance was not encouraged or rewarded. We are available to build, not to destroy. We are available to improve and enhance, not to settle scores with the past.Therefore, the Minister of Education Mrs. take immediately the initiative of dialogue with the unions representing teachers. With an open mind. But knowing what you want and do not want. I believe sincerely that the Portuguese want the Minister of Education Mrs. succeed. And that success will be of interest to teachers, schools, families and the country.A word also about the culture of politics - because knowledge and culture are part of the same chapter of the Government's program. A modern and well integrated country in the knowledge society, which has a wide view of qualifications, which is well aware of its identity, its values, its language and its heritage, it is a country that invests necessarily in Culture. And we will strengthen investment in culture during this term. As we consolidate a policy of language and preservation of historical and cultural heritage. And we will strengthen the incentives and support to artists and creators.Mr. PresidentFor the modernization of the country, we plan, fourthly, renew the ambition of the Technological Plan and advance innovation, technology and the knowledge society. Strengthening the Commitment to Science; increased private investment in research and development; the link between the scientific and technological system and the real economy; the guarantee of universal access to broadband; the continuation of the technological modernization of schools; and promotion of public serviceson line - Are just a few examples of an ambition of modernity that has come to stay. Fifthly, we want to strengthen business competitiveness. What it is is to support the competitive affirmation of small and medium-sized enterprises and to boost a new investment cycle in modernizing production sectors of tradable goods and services.We will devote special attention to the situation of our farmingIn particular in the sectors most affected by the negative trend in international markets. Finalize the main hydro-agricultural enterprises; we will create an export support program for agricultural and agro-industrial enterprises; We give new flexibility to implement the Proder and defend the interests of Portuguese agriculture in the future Common Agricultural Policy discussion.Sixthly, we want to continue to modernize or State. We will pursue the initiatives against bureaucracy and administrative simplification. We renew our ambition with Simplex 2.0 program and launch the licensing experience zero for certain economic activities smaller. And we will continue to revolutionize the care and training of public services, with the expansion of new network Citizen Shops of 2nd Generation.Our modernization strategy is part of a logic sustainable development; who takesambient as one of its main pillars and which is structured as part of a program of spatial planning e do regional development, Which has the active participation of local authorities and is oriented to territorial cohesion, the development of the interior and the protection of natural values. In this line, we assume, as a whole, the challenge of combating climate changeWhich calls the attention of all sectors, especially the energy sector, the transport sector, the industrial sector and the agro-forestry sector. We will continue also to developcity ​​policyWith a clear priority: the urban regeneration.As local authorities e as municipal associations shall, for the Government, the process of development partners and they deepen the skills decentralization policy at the service of the people.The Government will continue also to its development strategy and modernization of the country without ever forgetting Autonomous regionsand respect for the constitutional status of regional autonomy. We will strive to ensure good cooperation with the organs of government of the Regions, for the benefit of national and territorial cohesion.But, Mr. President, to be successful, a country's modernization strategy, capable of producing well-being for citizens, can not do without the guarantee of safety of people and goods and justice system more efficient.Internationally, Portugal continues to show favorable indicators in the field of security. But the state has the duty to respond to new forms of crime, especially the phenomena of violent crime. We will create, so extensions of the special units of the PSP and GNR, to patrol functions in the districts of Lisbon, Setúbal and Porto; annually will launch tenders for the admission of members to the security forces and not fail to strengthen the means and equipment at their disposal. We will create also the Brigade of Technological Research, to address new forms of cyber crime, hacking and child pornography.But our focus remains prevention. With community policing, local security contracts and the illegal arms seizure actions. In parallel, we will strengthen the coordination between the security forces and all relevant authorities, including international cooperation to combat terrorism, organized crime, the illegal immigration networks and trafficking in human beings.With regard to Justice, we want to continue to reduce the number of cases pending in our courts, As happened in the last three years. Simplify procedures; mobilize new technologies; promote alternative means of dispute resolution; invest in improving the facilities and the operating conditions and management of the courts; improve service and improve access to justice - here are some of the main topics of our reform agenda for the justice sector.A word, too, about the fighting corruption, We maintain one of the main priorities of criminal policy. The strengthening of the means of combating corruption is a duty that the Government will not fail, subject to our permanent readiness to consider the legal improvements as may be adjusted and necessary.But in this as in other areas, the country's problem is not a lack of laws but the difficulty in enforcing, effectively, laws that exist. Therefore, the most important contribution that political power can give to the competent authorities with regard to their means and operating operating conditions. But there is work to do in the field of prevention of corruption. It is time toinstitute in administration and public enterprises real codes of conduct and measures to prevent the risk of corruption. so we will act on the recommendations that have been formulated and will adopt a good practice that other countries have been implementing to address the same problem.9. Develop social policies, tackling inequalitiesMr. President Ladies and gentlemenThe third key priority of the Government Programme is develop social policies and to define public services and tackle inequalities.The country needs a strong welfare stateCapable of ensuring social protection, to meet new risks, to promote equal opportunities and to respond promptly in crisis situations such as the current one. We remain, so faithful to the defense of public social security and the National Health Service, as well as the promotion of public school as cohesion and equality factor. Maintain constant attention to social policies for the integration of immigrants - who have been so lauded internationally - we will continue to invest in social infrastructure and reinforce the measures to support families and promotion of birth.In this area, I want to highlight two measures: the first in the area of ​​nurseries: not only will continue the day care building program, as will double to 400 the number of day care centers with extended hours, especially in metropolitan areas. This is one of the most serious challenges of the modern welfare state: to guarantee to young families a network to which they can entrust their children and to enable them to reconcile their family life with their professional life, so that they can have the children they want.The second measure is the creation of the Future Savings Account. It is essentially a measure to encourage savings and to support the projects of the young: for every child born the state will deposit 200 euros in an individual account, giving even annually strengthened tax benefits related to savings that are deposited in this account. The young beneficiary can mobilize the balance of this account as soon as complete the required studies to support the financing of their life projects.But our main effort will continue to focus on combating poverty and inequality. For this further will expand the coverage of the solidarity supplement for the elderly. But we do more:we will create two new benefits. The first installment is intended to support working families with dependent children in order to ensure these families an income above the poverty line. The second provision is intended to ensure progressively an income above the poverty threshold also for people with disabilities generating total disability or too high to work.But I want to enter the debate on the minimum wage. To say, from logo, whichthe government is committed to compliance with the Agreement concluded with the social partners. And we are available, as indeed is expected to talk about the conditions of their implementation, in order to meet the current economic circunstancialismo. But we have more ambition.We want, at the conciliation, set new progressive increase in the minimum wage objectives, a medium-term framework.But I also want to refer to two very topical issues, increased pensions and increased social protection in unemployment.First pensions. This year will see is an absolutely extraordinary situation of negative inflation. This would determine if nothing were done, a reduction in the value of the most Portuguese pensions, which would be unacceptable.But for extraordinary situations extraordinary responses. I would like to communicate the decisions of the government regarding the increase in pensions this year:will increase pensions to about 630 euros at 1.25%, and pensions to € 1,500 by 1%. This means increasing the lowest pensions and maintain the value of the highest pensions. Taking account of inflation this represents a real increase of higher purchasing power to 2% for pensioners with lower pensions.It is the defense of one fundamental principle: more for those in need, the more benefit the elderly with lower pensions.Secondly, the unemployment protection. Notwithstanding the structural understanding reached in the Social Dialogue as the rules of the unemployment benefit decided to extend until the end of 2010 and as an extraordinary measure, the conditions of access to unemployment benefits.In order to strengthen social protection but also to meet the wishes of some social partners and some political forces, the government understands that in this period, the unemployment benefit is attributable to the unemployed with at least one year discounts in the last two years before the unemployment situation. Again: Extraordinary situations call for extraordinary measures.I want to leave, too, a word about the health policyTo draw attention to five key points. First, emphasize our commitment to prevention, in several critical areas, from tobacco to obesity, eating habits to vaccination plans and, in particular, in the face of the current problem of Influenza A. Second, to highlight extending to all children and young people aged between 4 and 16 years the so-called "dental checks". Third, to reaffirm our commitment to the reform of primary health care, so that by 2013 the Family Health Units can cover the entire national territory. Fourth, to realize that we will increase investment and expand the network of continuing care and home care. Fifth and finally, to emphasize thatare now building six new hospitals - Braga, Cascais, guard, Amarante, Lamego and pediatric Coimbra. And this our hospital park requalification unprecedented operation will continue with the construction of hospitals in Loures, Vila Franca, Lisbon and Eastern Algarve. This is how we can give good reasons for Portuguese have confidence and pride in their National Health Service will continue to be managed rigorously objective, efficient management and combat waste that characterized the management of recent years.And conclude the reference to social policy in the Government program, underlining our determination to promote equality and fight against discriminations. We will strengthen with the new Secretary of State for Equality, our attention to the promotion of gender equality, especially in the workplace, and combating the tragedy of domestic violence.E, the legitimacy of a popular mandate, the government will further the fight against all forms of discrimination and will present this Parliament, his bill to remove existing legal barriers to the realization of civil same-sex marriage.And not accepted here any lesson in democracy, nor the argument of those who remember the referendums only when it suits him. I opposed myself to the PS to vote a bill in the same direction because we had no mandate or legitimacy to do so. Now it happens thatwe have every right to approve this law. This proposal was the votes. I put it in my motion strategy, took it in his electoral program, defended it in public debate. I am therefore totally legitimate to make this proposal and get their approval in the House of the Republic. 10. Portugal in a changing worldMr. President Ladies and gentlemenIt is important that Portugal has clear ideas about their place in a world of uncertainty and constant change.The pillars of our Foreign policy and our Defence Policyremains, what is essential: our commitment to European integration; our transatlantic alliance; our special commitment to cooperation with Portuguese-speaking countries. We reaffirm our respect for international law; our loyalty to the guild system in which we integrate and readiness to take our share of responsibility in the necessary humanitarian and peace. We believe in multilateralism and the reference is the United Nations Charter, and we are determined to succeed in our bid to the Security Council for the biennium 2011-2012. We'll keep diplomacy attentive to the internationalization of the Portuguese economy, the recovery of a politics of language and culture - and not fail to pay attention to solidarity and Portuguese communities throughout the world.But there are two points of the utmost importance, which can not fail to mention here.The first relates to Europe: is great news for Europe and is great news for Portugal that the Lisbon Treaty is finally in a position to enter into force, will help to strengthen the European project. We wish this to happen and we have worked to make this happen. Europe will thus have new institutional conditions to respond to the challenges ahead. It's thename of Portugal, the name of Lisbon, will forever be associated with this important step in European integration!The second point concerns the new international order that the global economic crisis has made it even more urgent and necessary. The reform of international institutions, the establishment of more effective tools for regulating markets and financial flows, combatingoff-shoresand the shadow financial system zones, are subjects of an essential book for anyone who is willing to take seriously the lessons of the recent global economic crisis. These are, of course, global challenges that go far beyond the capacity of decision of a single State, especially a small country like ours. But a stronger Europe is also an opportunity for a more effective participation of Portugal in this discussion and in this reform movement. And Portugal is there a voice in defense of a more regulated globalization, to protect the world, economies and citizens of the reissue of such deep and serious crisis like the one that the world today is facing.11. An ambitious program, an attitude of trustMr. President Ladies and gentlemenHave asked me many times in these last days, is worried about political stability. I prefer to say that what worries me is working to solve the problems of the country. And that's what I intend to do. We all know, of course, that the problems benefits from the existence of political stability. But this only shows thatIt is not the government that wins with stability. It is the country that wins with political stability.Therefore, the most important at the beginning of the legislature is that responsibilities are clear. And they are very clear:Government, of course, is politically answerable to this Parliament. But all we respond to voters. And, for my part, I have no reason not to trust the judgment of the Portuguese. On the contrary, I always got along well with the judgment of the Portuguese.Mr. PresidentThe program that I presented here on behalf of the Government, is an ambitious program for the future of Portugal. It is a country's modernization strategy that sees beyond the situation and problems of the present. It is a program that aims to mobilize national energies.This program shows a turn, reflects a political - but above all reveals an attitude. The attitude of those who do not resign, who does not conform. The attitude of those who look to the future with confidence. The attitude of those who always want more and better for the Portuguese. Who wants more and better to Portugal!
