column8:
Transcrição das declarações do Primeiro-Ministro, Pedro Passos Coelho, e da
            
Chanceler Federal Alemã, Angela Merkel
            
Berlim, conferência de imprensa conjunta, 1 de Setembro de 2011
            

Chanceler Angela Merkel: Minhas Senhoras e Meus Senhores, é com grande prazer
            
que saúdo o Primeiro-Ministro de Portugal, Pedro Passos Coelho, hoje em Berlim.
            
Trata-se da sua primeira visita à Alemanha na qualidade de Primeiro-Ministro, uma vez
            
que só o é há pouco tempo. Trocámos, naturalmente, impressões sobre a situação na
            
União Europeia e, especialmente, sobre os esforços empreendidos por Portugal no
            
âmbito do programa para melhorar a competitividade e a situação financeira de
            
Portugal.
            
Tornei muito claro que apreciamos os esforços de Portugal e que nos alegramos por a
            
Missão que esteve em Portugal para proceder às primeiras avaliações ter classificado
            
estas medidas de bem sucedidas. Da parte do Primeiro-Ministro ouvi quais são as
            
reformas estruturais profundas que Portugal pretende efectuar para melhorar as
            
possibilidades de crescimento e emprego e, dessa forma, também fortalecer Portugal. É
            
um caminho corajoso. Estamos conscientes de que não é um caminho fácil. Por isso,
            
pela minha parte, também afirmei: sempre que Portugal necessite de apoio e ajuda
            
iremos prestá-los.
            
Iremos, portanto, mantermo-nos em estreito contacto. Também as empresas alemãs têm,
            
certamente, interesse quando se trata dos programas de privatizações em Portugal.
            
Fiquei hoje com a impressão que se está a trabalhar com um esforço extremo, com um
            
extremo rigor para melhorar a situação e, por isso, as minhas felicitações.
            
Falámos igualmente sobre as propostas germano-francesas que apresentámos para
            
melhorar a cooperação na Zona Euro. Também neste ponto temos uma apreciação
            
comum do que é necessário para evitar, no futuro, os erros do passado.
            
Ver-nos-emos hoje à tarde e à noite novamente em Paris, já que o Primeiro-Ministro
            
português vai tomar parte na Conferência sobre a Líbia, tal como eu. Portugal e a
            
Alemanha estão actualmente também intimamente ligados pelo seu trabalho comum no
            
Conselho de Segurança. Isto significa, portanto, que continuaremos a desenvolver as
            
nossas relações de forma estreita.
            
Muito obrigada pela visita de hoje.
            
Primeiro-Ministro Pedro Passos Coelho: Senhora Chanceler, muito obrigado. Este
            
encontro dos dois Governos foi muito útil, como a Senhora Chanceler já disse. Tive
            
oportunidade de informar o Governo alemão acerca dos esforços de Portugal no que diz
            
respeito à transposição dos programas que foram aprovados pelo Fundo Monetário
            
Internacional e pela União Europeia.
            
Da parte do Governo português e dos portugueses, queria expressar os meus
            
agradecimentos pela ajuda que estamos a receber nesta hora difícil, não só dos
            
europeus, mas também do Fundo Monetário Internacional. Trata-se de prestações não só
            
1 
            
 
            

a Portugal, mas também a outros países que se encontram em crise. Estamos gratos por
            
estes esforços. O melhor que podemos fazer para exprimir o nosso agradecimento é
            
cumprir o programa.
            
Como a Senhora Chanceler já disse: temos um problema orçamental em Portugal. O
            
problema está a ser resolvido. As medidas são muito ambiciosas e muito difíceis, mas
            
estão a ser postas em prática.
            
Contudo, temos igualmente dificuldades com a competitividade da economia, não só no
            
momento presente, mas já desde há dez anos. Estão a ser tomadas novas medidas, estão
            
a ser aprovadas e transpostas novas medidas. Avançou-se com muitas reformas
            
estruturais. Sou de opinião que a privatização em Portugal [tem de avançar]. Temos de
            
nos decidir por novos investimentos em Portugal, temos de abrir ainda mais a nossa
            
economia e gostaríamos que a nossa economia ficasse ainda mais integrada na Europa.
            
Disse à Senhora Chanceler que aguardamos com grande esperança os investimentos
            
alemães em Portugal. Já sei que há várias empresas muito interessadas no processo de
            
privatizações em Portugal – os investimentos são bem-vindos em Portugal.
            
Portugal foi o primeiro país da Comunidade Europeia que aboliu todos os direitos
            
especiais do Estado na economia privada. Serão também abolidos todos os privilégios
            
do Estado, para que as empresas sejam ainda mais competitivas.
            
Tivemos igualmente oportunidade de analisar o que está actualmente a suceder na
            
União Europeia e na Zona Euro. Encontrámos muito denominadores comuns.
            
[Tomámos] também medidas comuns para combater os défices, que já aprovámos na
            
Cimeira especial de 21 de Julho. [Neste contexto] refiro ainda a declaração final da
            
Cimeira germano-francesa. Todas as medidas para melhor controlo, melhor fiscalização
            
e melhor coordenação da política fiscal são condições básicas para o desenvolvimento
            
da União Europeia e para superar a crise.
            
Muitas economias da Europa estão a ser muito castigadas – mais do que deveriam ser –
            
se tivéssemos uma política comum. Todos os países que põem os seus programas em
            
prática deverão ter êxito e alcançar bons resultados.
            
Queria ainda dizer à Senhora Chanceler que estamos muito abertos. Esta abertura está
            
também nas nossas leis. Da parte do Governo português não há quaisquer reservas
            
relativamente às medidas aprovadas – sobretudo no que diz respeito ao limite às
            
dívidas, o travão ao endividamento. Estamos também muito abertos a tudo o que
            
pudermos fazer neste contexto, [por exemplo] se este travão do endividamento tiver de
            
ficar consagrado na Constituição.
            
Fora da Constituição já temos uma limitação na legislação portuguesa. Não vejo razão
            
para este travão ao endividamento não ficar consagrado na Constituição. Esperamos que
            
o maior partido da Oposição em Portugal, o Partido Socialista, também vá aprovar as
            
novas …[imperceptível]. Falaremos portanto também com este partido, para ver se
            
encontramos uma base comum a este respeito.
            
Pergunta: O Governo aprovou ontem um aumento de impostos, mas V. Exa. disse
            
ontem ao Primeiro-Ministro espanhol que não se introduziria um imposto sobre a
            
riqueza.
            
2 
            
 
            

Uma pergunta à Senhora Merkel: Está a favor de que este travão ao endividamento
            
seja consagrado na Constituição? O próximo passo será então a emissão de eurobonds?
            
Primeiro-Ministro Pedro Passos Coelho: No que diz respeito ao imposto sobre a
            
riqueza: dissemos que o capital não deve ser castigado [pois estamos] numa situação em
            
que necessitamos de capital. Ontem decidimos que as empresas com um lucro acima de
            
1,5 milhões de euros têm de pagar impostos adicionais. Isto é, iremos agora, com
            
grande lucro, cobrar mais impostos às famílias e às empresas.
            
Relativamente ao travão ao endividamento, que diz aquilo que foi decidido ontem, ele
            
prevê [medidas] para 2012 [que] são muito comparáveis com [as medidas de] 2007. Isto
            
significa um corte gigantesco no espaço dos últimos 5 anos. Quer dizer que o próximo
            
Orçamento irá utilizar muitas destas medidas. Queríamos, naturalmente, que o trabalho
            
se pudesse fazer já dentro de dois meses, mas também não devemos esperar dois anos
            
até se verificar a consolidação orçamental. Muitas coisas serão agora aprovadas como
            
objectivos e podem de facto ser transpostas até ao final de 2012.
            
Chanceler Angela Merkel: Fico naturalmente satisfeita por o Primeiro-Ministro se
            
mostrar muito aberto em relação à introdução de um travão ao endividamento.
            
Queremos fazê-lo para ter a certeza, para lá dos acontecimentos da política quotidiana,
            
que os Governos em toda a Zona Euro também põem em prática aquilo que prometeram
            
e que está no Pacto de Estabilidade e Crescimento. No passado sucedeu muitas vezes
            
esta promessa não ser cumprida, aliás também na Alemanha. Para ter a certeza e o
            
máximo de segurança é que sugerimos este travão ao endividamento.
            
Considero que os eurobonds são a resposta errada. Há diferenças na competitividade. Os
            
eurobonds são a colectivização das dívidas. Teríamos todos, então, a mesma taxa de
            
juro e não haveria qualquer incentivo, qualquer estímulo para se esforçar, para melhorar
            
a competitividade. Considero na realidade ser o caminho errado acreditar que nos
            
vemos livres das dívidas se as juntarmos todas na mesma panela. Por isso, o resultado
            
da nossa política deve ser a reaproximação das taxas de juro na Europa. Mas não está
            
bem aproximá-las artificialmente, colectivizando as dívidas.
            
Pergunta: Senhora Chanceler, teme que o FEEF perca o seu vigor se o Bundestag e
            
todos os outros Parlamentos Nacionais da Europa quiserem, em breve, ter uma palavra a
            
dizer de antemão sobre todas as decisões importantes?
            
Chanceler Angela Merkel:: Nós vivemos numa Democracia e estamos satisfeitos por
            
isso. Esta é uma Democracia Parlamentar e, por isso, o direito orçamental é um direito
            
fulcral do Parlamento. Nessa medida, encontraremos vias para configurar a codeterminação parlamentar de modo a serem, apesar de tudo, conforme com o mercado,
            
portanto, para o resultado serem sinais correspondentes aos mercados. Oiço, por
            
exemplo, dos nossos políticos que se dedicam ao Orçamento, que há consciência desta
            
responsabilidade. Mas temos de encontrar uma via na Europa para fazer o que é certo,
            
embora sejamos muitos países. Neste ponto, os Governos e as instituições europeias têm
            
de aprender a comunicar, em parte, e os Parlamentos também têm de aprender. Mas não
            
vejo motivo para os Parlamentos serem piores do que outros.
            

3 
            
 
            

Pergunta: Senhora Merkel, continuar a acreditar que os portugueses têm dias de férias
            
a mais e que se reformam muito cedo? No que diz respeito a eurobonds, creio que
            
Portugal tem uma opinião diferente da Alemanha.
            
Primeiro-Ministro Pedro Passos Coelho: Eu posso dar a minha resposta
            
imediatamente. Portugal também vê este problema de falta de chefia na Europa, mas
            
muitos problemas também são problemas estruturais que temos e que nós sabemos que
            
V. Exas. também os têm. Por isso aprovámos um programa de reformas. As economias
            
mais importantes da Europa, como a Alemanha e a França, deram contributos muito
            
positivos para uma resposta melhor.
            
Relativamente aos eurobonds: partilho, em grande parte, aquilo que disse a Senhora
            
Merkel. Não podemos considerar os eurobonds como solução para os problemas que
            
temos actualmente com o endividamento, porque a Europa precisa de um
            
aprofundamento da União Política e este aprofundamento não se pode realizar em pouco
            
tempo. Isto significa que não é só o Tratado de Lisboa que tem de ser alterado, mas
            
também as Constituições Nacionais na maior parte dos países europeus. Isto não quer
            
dizer que eu ache mal que se crie um aprofundamento da união política e dos contextos
            
na Europa. Temos, naturalmente, de criar futuramente uma melhor integração política,
            
mas há outros problemas que têm se ser resolvidos antes disso. Também são problemas.
            
Quer dizer, temos este tipo de solidariedade na Europa. Quer dizer, os países que já têm
            
uma notação melhor apoiam os países que têm uma notação pior. Talvez vá haver no
            
futuro um problema de credibilidade. Isto é, os países que hoje recebem ajuda, têm de
            
pôr em prática esta ajuda e também as garantias para que haja uma melhor convergência
            
e o aprofundamento da União Política possa desempenhar um papel diferente no futuro.
            
Chanceler Angela Merkel: Chamei sempre a atenção – e faço-o com todo o gosto
            
novamente – para o facto de, quando se tem uma moeda comum, se dever ter também
            
mais coisas em comum, além da moeda. Isto é o que nós entendemos por convergência
            
das diferentes áreas políticas. Isto tem algo a ver com o direito fiscal, tem algo a ver
            
com os sistemas de segurança social, tem algo a ver com os dias de trabalho e com
            
muito mais coisas. Quer dizer, portanto, relativamente às áreas políticas que hoje ainda
            
fazem parte das competências nacionais, que se deve ver melhor como são nos diversos
            
países.
            
Não vou mencionar quaisquer nomes e, de resto, também não mencionei nomes de
            
países de que tenha dito «isto está mal» ou «isto não está mal». Disse, sim, apenas que
            
não pode ser que uns se reformem muito cedo e outros muito tarde, que isso deverá
            
suceder de acordo com a situação demográfica – foi o que estabelecemos, por exemplo,
            
no Pacto pelo Euro – para que, dentro de dez ou vinte anos, um país não acabe por
            
despender uma grande percentagem das suas receitas com reformas e outro uma
            
pequena parte, ou que se viva à custa das gerações vindouras.
            
Temos de falar sobre todas estas questões na Europa. Não temos de fazer tudo igual,
            
mas no total a competitividade deverá ser comparável. Nos primeiros dez anos do Euro
            
falámos muito pouco disto. Por exemplo, Jean-Claude Trichet chamou muitas vezes a
            
atenção para a evolução dos salários na Função Pública dos diferentes países europeus,
            
que é extremamente diferente. Enquanto que na Alemanha houve um aumento de cerca
            
de 20% em dez anos, creio eu, nalguns países o aumento foi de mais de 100%. A longo
            
4 
            
 
            

prazo isto não pode ser. Tem de haver uma cooperação mais intensa agora entre os
            
Governos. Se se decidir aprofundar a União Europeia, então também se terá de entregar
            
cada vez mais competências à União Europeia. Temos de falar agora intensamente
            
sobre esta questão.
            
Pergunta: Senhora Chanceler, se me permite, gostaria ainda de colocar uma pergunta
            
acerca da Vizinhança mais alargada. Vai-se realizar em Paris a Conferência sobre a
            
Líbia. Que espera dela? Como encara o papel alemão?
            
Chanceler Angela Merkel: Alegro-me por os representantes do Conselho de Transição
            
nos irem explicar e dizer em Paris, hoje, que espécie de apoio desejam. A Alemanha
            
está pronta a oferecer bastantes coisas, precisamente no campo da disponibilidade de
            
água e ajuda técnica. A Líbia não terá o problema de dispor de pouco dinheiro, porque a
            
Líbia tem boas capacidades financeiras, mas o que será necessário muito depressa será
            
ajuda técnica e depois, naturalmente, também no estabelecimento de estruturas
            
democráticas. A Alemanha está pronta a ajudar também neste aspecto.
            
Creio que vamos ouvir nesta situação, em primeira mão, o que é necessário. Depois
            
poderemos comprometer-nos em relação ao contributo que queremos prestar. A
            
Alemanha irá, de qualquer modo, prestar um contributo visível.
            
(As notas relativas à parte em língua estrangeira foram efectuadas com base na
            
interpretação simultânea)
            
 
            

5

column1: CONFERÊNCIA SOBRE O ORÇAMENTO DO ESTADO PARA 2012, LISBOA, 25 DE OUTUBRO DE 2011
column6: Transcript of speech by the Prime Minister at the conference on the State Budget for 2012 organized by the Economic Daily Lisbon, 25 October 2011 Very good afternoon everyone. Really Dr. António Costa is right, we we scored this well in advance and we ended up having this event to occur at few hours of a Council of State, the President rightly called so that it could analyze the Portuguese situation within the perspectives European, what is happening across Europe and this eventually occur involuntarily also a day before it occurred the extraordinary summit of the eurozone, which we hope we will find a solution to the situation in Greece. Without this solution, we will not have financial stability in Europe, not in the Eurozone, and countries like Portugal will have even more trouble making their way to economic recovery due to the uncertainty and penalization that this uncertainty would bring worse way to exercise all economic agents. We are therefore at the time we played our destiny on several fronts. I have been very practical, I wanted at least to be very practical. When there are variables that do not depend on our owe us fix intervention those who depend on our decision. We can do everything well in Portugal and this is insufficient to ensure economic recovery. We are aware of this and know that our voice in the debate that is generating to find an answer out of Portugal in the European context, is between twenty-seven and tomorrow will be one of seventeen and the countries most undisciplined were, and we were undisciplined in recent years, despite the formal equal treatment, are not those who can force the decision of others. We know, therefore, that we have, externally, to look our intervention with dignity but with the proportion of the place we occupy. I believe, however, that Portugal's participation has been seen in a credible manner and has been heard. This was patent, namely, in any discussion involving the need for recapitalization of banks in European terms. It was noted that we would have preferred that this need for recapitalization were not directly linked to the banks' exposure to sovereign debt of European states. It was covered with the situation in Greece, but that was not directly associated with this position. However, as you know the EBA, the European Banking Authority, has this perception, the European Central Bank does not have this perception and the idea that prevailed was that European banks, all of them should be doubly protected, not only for the increased risk due to the Greek debt, but also due to the sovereign debt of all European Etados and since it happened in those terms, it was very important that we did not have too dynamic formula to be able to determine the terms on which this recapitalization need It is made. That is to say, where the valuation of assets in the face of these risks could be taken into account. We agreed so - was up by our intervention - get it right so that should set a deadline and a date before the decision so that this assessment was made, and that's how we reached the date of 30 September. That was positive and 1 reveals that when, even in the position where we intervene reasonably and technically well prepared, our views are heard and that's important. But I said to them that what is not in our hands we can condition, we can not ignore the decisions that we can take to determine our future and that perhaps it would be the first idea that I would like to stress here in this meeting. The fate of Portugal is not decided, we know that economic laws as, indeed, all others are much less deterministic than you think, have a strong probability associated, we know what happens to countries that have stories recurring financial indiscipline. We know that if we remain as a country of financial indiscipline the price to pay for it is too high a price from the social point of view, from an economic point of view and also from a political point of view. We were on the verge of pay that price when we asked foreign aid, we recognize that we did not have conditions to negotiate with our creditors more funding to the economy and the state itself unless we adopted certain policies and arrepiássemos way. Now we have to meet this way if we want to be taken seriously and do not want to return to the position of being on the edge of a cliff. The economic laws teach us what can happen if certain policies are not implemented, we a strong probability for a high degree of certainty, but do not tell us always, not always guarantee us what will happen if we adopt certain policies . So we must always keep ability to go adjusting the way. What do we know? We know that our way is by writing, we who write, we who make the decisions. Who today in Portugal want to feed any idea that we can continue to invest in the economic development model focused on public investment that brings no return to the economy or value, based on the granting of benefits subsidies and schemes or frames of budget protection or tax companies, is condemning the country to failure, the failure that was patent at the time had to ask for foreign aid - this we know. We know, therefore, what we should not do, the polemics that we should not feed the decisions that we should not again put on the table as reequacionáveis, reanalisáveis. These are excluded from the conclusions we saw arrive in Greece and even in Portugal at the time we had to ask for outside help. Second, we presented a budget that were here to discuss, for 2012, which is a much higher tax effort than that which was provided for in our economic and financial assistance program. Sensibly 2.4% of the product more than was originally planned. I think the Minister of Finance at the time of budget presentation made it very clear what was the reason for the adjustment to go beyond what was originally planned and it is not confused with a phrase that marked much a speech that just did at the beginning of this journey, which it was that we needed to go beyond the troika memorandum to power in Portugal, make the changes that were necessary for our economic system. 2 At that time I did not mean me clearly the fiscal effort, referred me to the structural change in the economy. But we have to go further than was originally planned in the budget at this point, just to maintain the same goals that were drawn, therefore, is not to go beyond the goals that were drawn. The Government has decided that would reduce the deficit to below what was planned in the coming years, instead of 4.5 like it was 4 or 3.5, for faster regressássemos the budget balance. Regressássemos, unless it is because I do not know if any of us here has a balanced budget of memory, but that we could achieve, that we could achieve, which is very relevant. What happens is that to achieve the same goal, given the slippage that was carried out and verified in the first half and in relation to what still will watch until the end of the year, particularly on the revenue side, as we have we assume that there is a level of revenue that was expected this year and could be completed by the end of the year, which is impossible, one that may not be a good idea to materialize, to the extent that may increase our tariff deficit, can -In put even a poorer position for further negotiation of other concessions that may be important, particularly with online gambling or simply with the game, asset sale that we refuse to do under it was made in the past, that is outside market conditions, both within the State accounting order to record cash inflow volumes that are unreasonable and then impose income levels support by the State itself that do not correspond to the valuation of real estate. All this has been done, you can not shoot behind us, but we can prevent further swell the problem. Therefore, as these are not recipes that interest us until the end of the year this figure will be higher than what was initially planned in terms of slippage due to the expense and the revenue that was registered for this year. For this reason it is that many of the measures that we had to find, especially horizontal nature are extremely heavy and we know, is a huge challenge for all Portuguese. We had a better alternative than this? Whereas, therefore, as an alternative? There would be a way to fix this gap of just over 2% of the product further reducing the expense of health, education, social security to speak of the areas that actually have important banks, which have significant budgetary allocation, because in the other, of course, we can make an even greater effort, but we know that the end result will never be such as to complete a deviation of about 2.4% of our product? I believe not. I have already presented my thoughts about it, thinking of the Government on this technically would be an alternative - but we did not accept - it was the tax increase. We could, of course, instead of having looked for pensions and salaries in the civil service and have then found the answer to this additional adjustment that is recorded on the expenditure side, to cancel these payments the state will not fit more revenue, will save the expense to perform. The alternative to fill this side of tax revenue was not an alternative we could accept for three fundamental reasons. First, hardly this exercise would be considered credible outside the country. Dir would be that Portugal is not making adjustment, Portugal's is an interim order to increase the tax burden on the revenue side to correct the imbalances that 3 has. This would not be seen in a credible way and not being seen in a credible way our economic and financial assistance program could die in November and we can not allow him to die in November. Second, because making this worse, was for individuals, whether for the general legal persons would further penalize the economic recovery effort that has to be done by the private side of the economy. We know that there is no other way, I will say that next, we need to invest a lot in all the export sector, we need to invest in a more open economy, so we need a stronger economic dynamism. If we were to further load in the economy that we have to recover from, we would be betting just evil, burdening those who can help us get out quickly from the situation where we are today. Therefore, further penalizaríamos consumption throughout society and further penalizaríamos the effort that companies will have to perform. And last but not least, we know that all private area still need to make adjustments. The state has to be aware of it, I'm aware of it. It was not just the state that got into debt in recent years. We know that our companies also need to adjust, need to increase their operating margins therefore need to have lower costs, need to restructure, know they will face credit constraints as they had no longer memory, need so that State do not drown even more with tax burden because they will have to make this adjustment and many of the people working in these companies will feel that hard, because they will lose their jobs. We should not be cynical in this matter, we know that for the year unfortunately, say, unfortunately unemployment will increase further in Portugal. And this bill is a bill that the public sector will not pay, but the private sector will pay and the Portuguese will pay. Now it would make sense that knowing the state this, yet this became heavier bill when, as I mentioned, we need the private sector of the economy to get out of this crisis sooner, faster and more vigorously. Therefore, it is explained, I hope, why we took the option we took. That said, it's not worth also walk around the same words and say that we are pitiless toward a group of Portuguese society and that this can not be, can entail results that we would not want. When in a state of national emergency, we are aware of the difficulties. Believe we have and have no pleasure, strictly no, in being to penalize whoever, but if anyone knows of a way to reduce debt, reduce the deficit, enriching and spending more, say if they please, because we would all be able to adopt these fantastic ideas. But we do not know this way of producing results, what we know is that there were countries - yesterday the mentioned - in northern Europe in the last twenty, ten years were extremely vigorous economic adjustments with high unemployment, with the economic downturn, but could redesign your public machine without jeopardizing the welfare state, managed to recover from the financial situation in which they were and are still the most consistent growth rates in the European area. Canada has gone through such a process too, in the late 90s, Ireland is going through this process. 4 not worth doing demagoguery about this, we know that we will only get out of this impoverishing in relative terms, in absolute terms the extent that our GDP is falling, but it will be made out of this crisis and to recover one path of economic growth and not to stay, as they say, the budget hole in the restrictive measures consecutively retro-feed the loss of competitiveness and the economic downturn. What we are doing is out of recession, not to aggravate the recession. Third, the message that I think is positive and important. We want to change some of the fundamentals of the economic system in which we live. This is beginning to be clear in this state budget. When we say we will start a restructuring process of the business sector of the state and this is already poured, in part, in the state budget. We are already plotting a different way of those who was being followed over the past few years. Public companies - are six public companies that are now in the state of the scope of consolidation that were not before - these six companies, at least, have carried their budgets to the state budget this year, to take effect in 2012. In these course companies, the rule is that there can be no operating losses, operating losses provided that the state fulfills what is your mission to transfer beyond the resources that are necessary due to the public service that they develop, but not more than that. The effort will be made in these companies is huge, it means that for some many hundreds of millions of euros, I think that the top - not the precise value here now memory, I think the Minister of Finance or the Secretary of the Treasury in any case the mentioned explicitly in his press conference - but it is more than seven hundred million euros. It does not appear in the budget of this size because the interest costs that worsen next year. But then, if we remove all that is debt burden, exercise with what are the responsibilities of the past, the truth is that the reduction of value that is hidden is more than seven hundred million euros. It is the first time that this happens in Portugal and this path is to proceed in that it should be extended to the whole business sector and should be accompanied by a new vision of how the state should work in the economic area. We next week we will approve the Council of Ministers in order to submit to Parliament, new guidelines for the status of public and nature of public institutions managers as well as the rest of the rules that apply to ministerial offices and the government. Our intention is to proceed as we have done in relation to senior leaders of government. They should not be the result of a mere policy choice, they should correspond to a recruitment exercise that is far beyond the political trust and involving merit, regardless of party area that come from those who are likely to be the leaders of public administration of the future and it will not happen after the next election will take place during the term of this government. People know today that are being invited and who are taking possession of managerial roles of administration, that by 2013 there will be tenders to provide those places in terms different from what happened today, but we will act in the same way in relation to public companies and public institutes. Reducing the number of directors, which is seven should be five if not for three, and where there are five pass to three. 5 In all areas that are protected from market indexing their salaries to what is the salary of the President of the Republic or the Prime Minister, ensuring a market condition for all state companies that are in competition, allowing for a time to stipulate earned average incomes may be preferred to these if we are competitive in areas of public companies. It's a complete change of regime for all that has been observed and how the state will maintain its willingness to withdraw from a large part of the economy business complements this view that the state does not exist on our accession to have many companies; what the state should regulate well is the role of the economy. This is your role, this should be the rule, public companies should be the exception rather than the opposite and the same with regard to public institutions and State offices to make at least one change that is very important, that is to end the parallel state - said it before the elections and I repeat it now - to end this idea of ​​a parallel state which is built in the offices of ministers and secretaries of state and disqualifies administration. I realize that there are state secretaries and ministers who wish to, because they have large sectors in charge, they need to have more advisors and more deputies to deal with matters, but must look for them in the public administration. It is calling the government that we provide a good service for the future, avoiding that every time a government is replaced or a ministerial team is replaced, all the knowledge, all the power out with the holders of such places. It must remain in the administration so that it is actually the state and not the Government. I know it's not comfortable making these changes, it is easier to talk to them than make them happen, but we'll even realize them and this will bring an added difficulty for members of the Government who will want to have fewer resources at their disposal to get the same results, but will have to obtain them using the administration and if necessary qualify administration, that qualifies administration. We are therefore in a way in which our goal is to be able to match public spending as a percentage of GDP with our ability to generate wealth and this proportion to what we pay taxes and contributions to social security. Next year we will download three points the weight of public expenditure in GDP, despite the contraction in GDP, which means therefore a very serious effort; and our vision is that by 2015 we can have a government expenditure ratio at around 43.5%. Moreover, next year we will have a primary surplus, which means not counting debt service, we would have been achieved, with taxes and contributions, pay our social spending and sovereignty expense of the State which is extraordinarily important and does not happen in Portugal for very many years. But of course this is not enough. We also have to also find a way to solve the problem of public liability that exists on the side of the State entrepreneurial sector. Notice that direct public debt and corporate debt, especially those who are in the state of consolidation perimeter, will cost for next year more than eight billion euros in interest. and repair the size of this number, we are talking about 5% of the product, 6 nearly nine billion. Just think for a moment what we could do with half that amount in interest from an economic point of view. No, not for now say the administration can return to spend - not; what we could do with this money in support of entrepreneurship, innovation, exports, the economy, the qualification of the Portuguese. What we could not do for a year with this figure? This is how we face this year. This is the reason why we can not take longer to combat the debt that today weigh in and weigh it. Pesa, is not the government, is the country is the Portuguese. So we have to know how to reduce the weight of this debt, this is done in two ways. Well, first of all with the assumption that we will not worsen and that therefore all that we can avoid more PPP in more decisions of this nature for the future that we cancel now and that it be assumed, can not swell the problem. This is the first assumption, but we must do this in two ways. First getting consolidate these problems we have, making the restructuring of state-owned enterprises, it is vital for Portugal, I believe that this point of view the areas that most weight gain in this area, which are those linked to transport, have really an implementation of the strategic program of transport in terms of what has been outlined and the troika accepted as a good one. We have to do business restructuring, we have to reduce operating expenses, we have to join, merge companies and better coordinate their activities, we have to use common resources more efficiently and above all we can not walk to put these companies or competition or a back to back to each other when the tender offer should be complementary and rationalize and this will be done. Unfortunately, the cost of past investments in desobrigaram not to raise prices of tariffs. Look well, we're not to raise tariffs in areas donates transport because the update for inflation had not been made over the years, it was relatively made simply investment decisions taken today dictate that the cost of using equipment is much higher and so the Portuguese will pay a part of this irrationality that the State has in the past. Still, as mandated by the principle of social equity, we kept social tariffs which are still slightly lower than those which existed before these increases for those who have incomes actually very low. This social concern has to exist, but secondly we have to find a solution to the refinancing of these liabilities while operating results or concessions or privatization itself does not solve the rest. Does this mean therefore treat of the economy's financing conditions as a whole. Today it is clear that the assumption that existed in economic and financial assistance program, which was that the Portuguese public companies refinanciariam in foreign markets, it is unrealistic. This principle today is not the case. At the time the program was chalked it had this expectation, in the same way that the state could go to market. The Treasury bills for the short term, public enterprises could renegotiate its liabilities to the international banking. But as this assumption for companies today no longer in effect, what is happening, what is happening is that or is the Treasury or is the national bank that has to help refinance these liabilities. The needs of 7 refinancing have reached the end of this year, about 3 000 million, a little more. Are rigorously 3,220 million by the end of the year, of which about 140-150 is new debt, the rest is refinancing. That is not possible in the process of financial deleveraging banks refinance this debt, are 3 000 million this year, may be 4 000 million for the year 2014 could be a total of 15 to 16 billion. It is not possible in the process of financial deleveraging banks keep lending to the private sector and also refinance the public system. So we have to find a solution to this and this is on our agenda with the troika. We can not allow the private economy is suffocated by the weight of the debt of public business sector. We have to find here, so a mechanism for greater flexibility. If there was possibility of idealizing, tomorrow it will be approved, I hope, financial leverage mechanisms to the European Fund for financial stability which constitutes a sufficiently powerful firewall to contain systemic risks in the Eurozone there-of is also possible, in Portugal, find a way to solve this problem, which is a practical problem that we we have and that was not solved at the beginning of the program. This is crucial for us to keep the lines of financing for the economy, but I insist on this point, which is very important, you can only get the European Central Bank, the European Commission, the International Monetary Fund an opening to discuss with us this problem, which is a practical problem, not the result of our incompetence, our skid, our failure is clear from unreality of some assumptions that are in the program and have to be adjusted to reality. We only obtain opening for this is our financial year is credible because it is not the answer we hear is known, is "do not believe the assumptions that the Government is to develop, the masters have no credibility to discuss what they will do or more money, or leverage what they have, so either we redesign the entire program as in the case of Greece and we see that more austerity is coming, that more layoffs will occur, more severe restructuring will have to happen before we open to idealize the new program, because what you need is a new program. " But that's not what we want, what we want is to adjust our program to reality, is not to make a new program. What we want, therefore, is to say we are doing our part of the job, our part of the work is to show that we are to correct the imbalances that we ourselves have created. Let me say this here too, though, I'm sorry if I'm being a little longer than idealized, but sometimes these messages must pass regardless of the hearing that we put in. You know this and the ladies, I'm sorry to say, but I am also talking to the country, many people think that Europe has an obligation to help us, that is their obligation, we will pay. Now it is true that Europe has shown a very important principle of solidarity. It was Europe, it was the International Monetary Fund as well - 20%, a fifth of the funding is given by many countries that have not reached the levels of development that we have achieved, attention, this is also a solidarity that we can not forget - but the truth is that four-fifths were the European countries that we financed. Of course we'll pay back, I was missing if not we pay back, but notice that these countries indebted to 8 to lend us this money. If you follow the logic that Portugal followed in recent years, could be taken into debt to do many other things in their countries, there is an opportunity cost associated with the debt they fought, they fought this debt, fought not apologize, did this indebtedness to help Portugal, knowing that benefit indirectly stability across the euro area, for sure, as we benefit stability in Spain, France, Germany, but the truth is that the only way to this spirit of solidarity work, are we show that we are correcting our imbalances, because if not we would be witnessing was the debt of economies that have worked with economic balance at the expense of its citizens to fund those who understand that should simply borrow because there are always those who pay the bill out there. All those who have lent us money make it an effort of European solidarity and European cohesion, but hope of course that we can correct what brought us here. So that's what we have to do if we want to be seen as a dignified nation have a right to be and what we are. The rescue our autonomy, it is not our financial independence, there is no independent countries this view anywhere in the world. United States continue to be the largest economic giant, however, are funded in your debt as you know all the Asian markets. So there is no doubt that no one is independent, but if we want to regain a word of autonomy in the choices we make, so we have to pay what we owe and we have to correct imbalances. For this I believe - and this is what I would say to finish - for this we need to change economic structures beginning in the state but also in the private sector. We need arguably bet even more on exports and as we have an economic cooling panorama in Europe in the coming years, and Europe account for over 70% of our exports, it means that we have to concentrate financial capital, human capital in exports outside Europe. This is indispensable. Recognizing this, the State and Government adopted an economic diplomacy orientation that seeks to strengthen this bet. We need, with Portuguese entrepreneurs, to bet on markets that are outside of Europe, Africa, Latin America, the Middle, that is where we have to go back. If our market here in will not grow, on the contrary, then it is clear that we can all get back to us out even faster. And we should all be together in a true partnership. If we invest enough in innovation and entrepreneurship, entrepreneur spirit, I am convinced that the results will not show up in two days, but we started a different economic regime in Portugal. If every time we speak of foreign capital inflows, we we are not talking about national decision centers if every time we take in our interests, our economic strategic interest, we think of our business and in our businesses and in they have outside of Portugal and know help and further open doors and get the point of view of the financial condition and credit risk, they may have a more favorable environment, not to stay protected, but to be able to expose more the competition, we will change the arrangements in Portugal. And we need to do at a very high speed. 9 conclude, therefore, with an optimistic message, fairly optimistic because I feel that we are doing what it takes, that our direction is the right direction. We can fine-tune policies, we can for sure. I have said, is not to answer to anyone, it is intellectual honesty, no one owns the truth. No one ever has all the right policies, we have to be always open to improve our policies, we have to be always available and open to dialogue in society. To dialogue with the opposition parties when we are in the Government, trade unions and businesses when we are looking at the social and economic fabric, dialogue with external partners when we are looking at internationalization. We have to always be open to this dialogue and to address the policy, but we have to know what is the way that we walk, we can not look like fools in the middle of the bridge, which both dialogue and so aperture do not know if they will -from go to one side or will-go to another and when the bridge begins to collapse on each side going down with the bridge because we have not taken a decision. We have to know what is the way we want to follow. Now we trace a path to follow and it is in this way that we are open to dialogue with all, we share sacrifices with the Portuguese who will go for sure next year, but we know that being next year the hardest adjustment It will not be the last. So we will be with the Portuguese showing that we know to be frugal, we perceive its difficulties, the need to help, but that this effort will be worth it because the way that we draw is out of this crisis, is not to get lost in it. The expectation is that Europe will help in this process, because Europe did not reach - Europe 17 - which has not reached the serious imbalances that we have is also moving towards them, is also moving towards them. It is no accident that also discusses the social model in Europe and the debt in Europe and that EBA has proposed that all banks were re-examined in view of the public debt of the sovereign. So it is not only Portugal or Ireland, is also of Spain, is from France, is from Germany and so on. Europe also has to reform and I know that European leaders today have an absolute sense of this, that for this purpose we need to have an economic union that is not built yet and we need to create a real political union so that convergence may exist, not only in nominal terms but also in real terms. But that's all in our hands, in your and in government hands, in the hands of Brussels and European, but I am convinced that we will overcome this bad phase where we are and that we have a path of reform and growth to us, so we know, as they say, clenching and do what it takes to face while the storm. 10
